oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Memphis Belle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "Memphis Belle" with color image of plane. Eight signatures of crew members: Harold Loch, Top Turret; Bill Winchell, Left Waist Gunner; Eugene Adkins, Ball Turret; Robt. Morgan, Pilot; J.P. Quinlan, Tail Guns; Cass Nastal, Right Waist Gunner; Bob Hanson, Radio; Jim Verinis, Co-Pilot.

Typed: "The Memphis Belle is a B-17 'flying fortress' that completed 25 missions over German occupied Europe during WWII. This famous plane is now on permanent display at Mud Island in Memphis, Tennessee. Named for Margaret Polk, whom pilot Robert K. Morgan met during the war, the Belle is a stirring reminder of those who fought so bravely in WWII. The Memphis Belle is on loan from the United States Air Force Museum to the Memphis Belle Memorial Association." -- Stamped: "Frank G. Donofrio -- 5647 Hinton Pl. Cove -- Memphis, TN 38119"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Memphis Belle; World War II; aviation; airplanes; Mud Island; Adkins, Eugene; Hanson, Robert; Loch, Harold P.; Morgan, Robert K.; Nastal, Casimer; Quinlan, John P.; Verinis, James; Winchell, Clarence E.;
